page.title: 11MARSTON TRUSSELL SCHOOL
page.content: In Marston Trussell there was a charity school in church.{It was} {founded in 1852}There were 35 children in one classroom with a curtain splitting older children from infants.The first teacher was there for 30 years on a salary of Â£30 a year.The headmaster,Mr.William Flint,lived in the village.The infant teacher lodged in the village.In 15 years there were 11 teachers. In 1926 the headmistress was Miss Worthington on a salary of Â£95. Children went to school from 5 to 13 or 14.There were no school dinners.The children had 5 weeks summer holiday and 1 week at Easter{The school closed {in 1942}as there weren't enough children in the village.Infants now travel to Clipston and the older children go to Guilborough.The{school is{now}a{village hall.}(See page 15)
